text: [Music]
I like working with AWS because in the
beginning of drop cam I actually had to
pack up cameras into boxes and ship them
but we've never had to Rack a server by
[Music]
hand i'm Greg Duffy I'm the CEO of
Dropcam the average Dropcam customer is
a Suburban family so people with kids or
pets and they want to see what's going
on at home and get alerts when things
happen the unique thing about drop cam
is that although it's a simple consumer
device we actually take in more video
than YouTube in the cloud YouTube takes
in about 100 hours of video every minute
and drop cam is orders of magnitude more
than that and that's a huge technical
challenge that we take on with the help
of AWS we moved to AWS and uh around May
of 2012 the AWS team announced free
inbound data pricing which uh is is not
totally a coincidence we obviously take
in all of this video it was really
important to us that we were able to do
that without breaking the bank so while
we do spend a good amount of money on
things like compute resources and
storage that was a big factor in us
being able to move over so that was a
great move on the part of the AWS team
to enable services like drop cam to run
on the cloud all of our video comes into
a server software called Nexus that runs
on ec2 so we use reserved instances uh
in ec2 because it's a steady state load
as cameras come online we add Nexus
servers from there we actually built
this custom video data structure to
store all of that dropkin video we built
that custom data structure on top of
Dynamo DB and S3 and our website uses a
collection of Technologies as well we
run the website on ec2 with python on
postgresql we're really excited to see
that uh that RDS is going to start
supporting postgres really great news
for
us we're the best cloud video monitoring
Solution on the market in part because
we don't spend time you know worrying
about things like racking servers in a
data center or buying hard drives or all
the other things that AWS does for us so
we can focus on the platform innovations
that make drop Kim unique to our
customers so things like video analysis
things like dealing with the amazing
amount of video that comes into the
system making great apps for viewing the
video in real time one of the coolest
things that drop Kem has built is called
our CVR Cloud video recording and that's
built on top of Dynamo DB and S3 when we
hire the next developer put them to work
on our Cloud video analysis we can put
them to work on our apps we can put them
to work on the camera we don't have to
hire an Ops person and that for a
startup that really matters because
every dollar every new engineer that you
hire it's opportunity cost our team
chose AWS because you can pick the
pieces that you want to use and don't
have to pick the pieces that you don't
want to use so whatever is right for
your company you can add kind of your
DNA to your solution not have to make
everything conformed to a specific
architecture we actually have a really
good relationship with the AWS team
where they're helping us by providing
the infrastructure that we need to grow
drop cam and we're actually helping them
too by doing things like pushing all
this data inbound to the cloud this is a
story of innovation by delivering all
these cloud services to companies like
drop cam that are going to push things
to the Limit we've been able to do a lot
of cool stuff thanks to the help of the
AWS to take in all that data do you know
cool video analysis for the users all
the things where drop cam can add value
but we've you know like I said never had
to Rack a server which is really
cool
